actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to encourage the production of energy by allowing the amortization based on a 60-month period of facilities producing unleaded gasoline, heating oil, diesel fuel, solar or wind energy equipment, or synthetic fuels.
short_title: Energy Production Encouragement Tax Act of 1979

summary.text: Energy Production Encouragement Tax Act of 1979 - Amends the Internal Revenue Code to allow an income tax deduction with respect to the amortization based on a 60 month period of facilities producing unleaded gasoline, heating oil, diesel fuel, solar or wind energy equipment, or synthetic fuels.

titles.title: Energy Production Encouragement Tax Act of 1979

A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to encourage the production of energy by allowing the amortization based on a 60-month period of facilities producing unleaded gasoline, heating oil, diesel fuel, solar or wind energy equipment, or synthetic fuels.
